Name Type Description

(inherited from Control).
itemFormatter Function Gets or sets the item formatter function.
itemsSource any Gets or sets the array or ICollectionView that contains the data used to create the chart.
legend Legend Gets the chart legend.
palette string Gets or sets an array with default colors used for displaying each series.
plotMargin any

Gets or sets the plot margin.

The plot margin represents the area between the edges of the control and the plot area.

By default, this value is calculated automatically based on the space required by the axis labels, but you can override it in case you want to control the precise position of the plot area within the control (for example when aligning multiple chart controls on a page).

You may set this property to a numeric value or to a CSS-style margin specification. For example:

// set the plot margin to 20 pixels on all sides
chart.plotMargin = 20;
// set the plot margin for top, right, bottom, left sides
chart.plotMargin = '10 15 20 25';
// set the plot margin for top/bottom (10px) and left/right (20px)
chart.plotMargin = '10 20';

selectionMode SelectionMode Gets or sets the chart selection mode.

Methods

Name Parameters Return Type Description
applyTemplate(classNames, template, parts, namePart)
  • classNames (string): Names of classes to add to the control's host element.
  • template (JQuery): A jQuery variable that contains the instantiated template.
  • parts (Object): A dictionary of part variables and their names.
  • namePart (string): Name of the part to be named after the host element. This determines how the control submits data when used in forms.
 void

Applies the template to a new instance of a control.

This method should be called by constructors of templated controls. It is responsible for binding the template parts to the corresponding control members.

For example, the code below applies a template to an instance of an InputNumber control. The template must contain elements with the 'wj-part' attribute set to 'input', 'btn-inc', and 'btn-dec'. The control members '_tbx', '_btnUp', and '_btnDn' will be assigned references to these elements.

this.applyTemplate('wj-control wj-inputnumber', template, {
  _tbx: 'input',
  _btnUp: 'btn-inc',
  _btnDn: 'btn-dec'
}, 'input');


(inherited from Control).
beginUpdate() void Suspends notifications until the next call to endUpdate.
(inherited from Control).
constructor(element, options, invalidateOnResize)
  • element (any): The DOM element that will host the control, or a jQuery selector (e.g. '#theCtrl').
  • options (): JavaScript object containing initialization data for the control. (default Value: null)
  • invalidateOnResize (boolean): Whether the control should be invalidated when it is resized. (default Value: false)
 void Initializes a new instance of a Control and attaches it to a DOM element.
(inherited from Control).
containsFocus() boolean Checks whether this control contains the focused element.
(inherited from Control).
deferUpdate(fn)
  • fn (Function): Function to be executed.
 void

Executes a function within a beginUpdate/endUpdate block.

The control will not be updated until the function has been executed. This method ensures endUpdate is called even if the function throws.


(inherited from Control).
dispose() void Disposes of the control by removing its association with the host element.
(inherited from Control).
endUpdate() void Resumes notifications suspended by calls to beginUpdate.
(inherited from Control).
focus() void Sets the focus to this control.
(inherited from Control).
S getControl(element)
  • element (any): The DOM element that is hosting the control, or a jQuery selector (e.g. '#theCtrl').
 Control Gets the control that is hosted in a given DOM element.
(inherited from Control).
getTemplate() string

Gets the HTML template used to create instances of the control.

This method traverses up the class hierarchy to find the nearest ancestor that specifies a control template. For example, if you specify a prototype for the ComboBox control, it will override the template defined by the DropDown base class.


(inherited from Control).
initialize(options)
  • options (any): Object that contains the initialization data.
 void

Initializes the control by copying the properties from a given object.

This method allows you to initialize controls using plain data objects instead of setting the value of each property in code.

For example: 

grid.initialize({
  itemsSource: myList,
  autoGenerateColumns: false,
  columns: [{ binding: 'ID', header: 'Code', width: 130 }, ... }]
});
// is equivalent to
grid.itemsSource = myList;
grid.autoGenerateColumns = false;
// etc.

The initialization data is type-checked as it is applied. If the initialization object contains unknown property names or invalid data types, this method will throw.


(inherited from Control).
invalidate(fullUpdate)
  • fullUpdate (boolean): Whether to update the control layout as well as the content. (default Value: true)
 void Invalidates the control causing an asynchronous refresh.
(inherited from Control).

refresh(fullUpdate)
  • fullUpdate (boolean): Whether to update the control layout as well as the content. (default Value: true)
 void Refreshes the chart.
